H0.text: Compounds are what a molecule forms when it is separated into its component parts.

H1.text: Atoms are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

H2.text: Protons are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

H3.text: Ions are formed when a molecule is separated into its component parts.

A4.text: Atoms can attach to one or more other atoms by chemical bonds to form chemical compounds such as molecules or crystals.

A5.text: Atoms are the basic particles of the chemical elements and the fundamental building blocks of matter.

A6.text: A chemical bond is the association of atoms or ions to form molecules, crystals, and other structures.

A7.text: In the second case, both electrons of the chemical bond remain with one of the products, resulting in charged ions.

A8.text: Dissociation of a molecule AB into fragments A and B
